result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex James Kranz

records.addlTxt:
10:32 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Alex James Kranz. Defendant Alex James Kranz in court, in custody. Court reviews file. Atty. Harrelson states that there is a revocation pending, no resolution on this case, requests PLEAS. ADA Ellenwood responds. Atty. Harrelson states that DE has applied to treatment court, awaiting decision. Court sets PLEAH. Court provides counsel with correspondence from DE to court. Adjourned: 10:41 AM. kma
Plea hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea hearing on November 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:45 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Alex James Kranz. Defendant Alex James Kranz appeared by video in custody. Atty. Harrelson states that there are continued negotiations with a revocation pending. Court sets STC. Adjourned: 9:48 AM. kma
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Filed by ADA Ellenwood. arc    e: Atty Harrelson

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Alex James Kranz
Current: 1145 Davis St 4, Hammond, WI 54015   (Effective: 07-25-2022)
Prior: 1145 Davis St 1, Hammond, WI 54015

- No use or possession of dangerous weapons

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:50 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood and Intern Ali Casey in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Alex James Kranz. Defendant Alex James Kranz appeared by video, in custody. DE qualifies for public defender. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. State requests bond. DE is on PO hold. Atty. Harrelson waives speedy prelim. Court sets bond. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 1:52 PM. kma
Settlement conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
